34 import sys
35 import rospy
36 import argparse
37 from ros_python_lib_example.oracle import Oracle
38 
39 def parse_args():
40  format_class = argparse.RawDescriptionHelpFormatter
41  parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(formatter_class=format_class,
42  description='ROS node making the oracle available via ROS')
43  parser.add_argument('--seed', action="store",
44  help='Specify the integer seed for the Oracle!')
45 
46  args = parser.parse_args(rospy.myargv()[1:])
47  return args
48 
49 
50 class OracleNode(object):
51  def __init__(self, seed):
52  rospy.init_node('OracleNode')
53 
54  self.oracle = Oracle(seed=seed)
55 
56  rospy.on_shutdown(self.shutdown_hook)
57 
58  rate = rospy.Rate(1.0)
59  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
60  rospy.loginfo(self.oracle.getPrediction(0, 10))
61  rate.sleep()
62 
63  print('exiting')
64 
65  def shutdown_hook(self):
66  rospy.loginfo("Shutting down. The oracle thanks for feeding the seeds: {}".format(self.oracle.seeds))
67 
68 
69 
70 
71 if __name__ == "__main__":
72  args = parse_args()
73  print(args)
74  o = OracleNode(int(args.seed))
